definition: cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms

sentences.english: Hope that the United States will abandon the Cold War mentality, not in Hongkong to engage in political gamesmanship.
sentences.chinese: 希望美方摒棄冷戰思維，不在香港搞政治上的小動作。

sentences.english: EG:Another effort entails bringing the entire community into the post-ColdWar era.
sentences.chinese: 大家也在努力使整個智囊團進入加速冷戰時期。

sentences.english: Throughout much of the cold war Beijing and Moscow were enemies.
sentences.chinese: 在冷戰的許多時間裏，中俄兩國都處於敵對狀態。

sentences.english: The Cold War was still on.
sentences.chinese: 那個時候冷戰還在繼續。

sentences.english: We all smiled. The Cold War seemed a long time ago.
sentences.chinese: 我們都面帶微笑，冷戰似乎已經過去好久了。

sentences.english: The Cold War was also a sporting war, with US–Soviet rivalries played out every four years.
sentences.chinese: 冷戰也體現在體育對抗上，每四年演繹一場美蘇對抗。

sentences.english: The displacer piston now moves, shunting the gas to the cold end of the cylinder.
sentences.chinese: 活塞的置換現在動作，調氣，以冷戰結束缸。

sentences.english: Illegals could also be present in other nations, just like in the Cold War?
sentences.chinese: 就像在冷戰中一樣，非法者也會在別的國家出現？

sentences.english: The course closes by considering the place of science in the post-Cold-War era.
sentences.chinese: 最後這門課將以科學在冷戰時代所持的立場爲結尾。

sentences.english: But as a diplomat, Kissinger recollects Kennan was a hot temper in the cold war;
sentences.chinese: 但作爲一位外交家，凱南可算是冷戰中的一個暴脾氣。

sentences.english: This had a far-reaching effects on pattern of US-Soviet Cold War and the situation in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 這對美蘇冷戰格局和中東局勢都產生了深遠影響。

sentences.english: When the cold war ended, the Pacific Ocean became, in effect, an American lake.
sentences.chinese: 冷戰結束後，太平洋在實際上已經成爲美國的內湖。

sentences.english: The Vietnam War was one of hot wars under the Cold War background.
sentences.chinese: 越南戰爭是冷戰大背景下的一場熱戰。

sentences.english: The US-Anglo "special relationship" is intangible, and the Cold War is tangible.
sentences.chinese: 美英“特殊關係”是無形的，而冷戰是有形的。

sentences.english: This is the biggest post-Cold War US-Russian spy scandal broke.
sentences.chinese: 這是冷戰結束後爆出的最大俄美間諜醜聞。

sentences.english: Just a cold heart to empty.

definition: now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to be in a tangle/to nag
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
